column182:
Zoning map shows RMX as an additional village district -- The Zoning director informed me via email 4/6 that while they are not proposing to change any of the district boundaries, B-2 and RMX districts may be combining. This would support the absence of  RMX as an official district in the ordinance text. 

Using numbers from zoning ordinance update, to be finalized this spring: https://www.gloucesterva.info/1135/Zoning-Ordinance-Update 

Many contextual fields, including parking and setbacks. Using the setback from major roads/highways instead of from pedestrian walkway, per Atlas instructions. 

Regulations in B-2 override general requirements for townhouses and structures elsewhere in the ordinance. 

---
Eric's Notes:
The code defers to supplemental regulations for townhouse development for lot requirements. Those supplemental regulations will override the provisions in the base zoning district (see "Minimum lot area: 2,500 square feet (or as specified in Article 9B Supplementary Use Regulations for specific uses)" as an example).

Parking requirements exist in another part of the county's ordinances.

There's some mental gymnastics that have to be done based on the streetscape requirements in B2. When you add it all up, the setback requirements are actually 15 feet.
column183: 1-Family Treatment is limited to single-family attached (townhouse) development. Additional setback requirements are required if abutting SF-1, SC-1, C-2, RC-1, or RC-2.

Maximum residential density is set at 0.2 units/gross acre.

Cluster development of single-family detached homes is allowed. In C-2, 1 acre minimum lots at a gross density of 1 dwelling unit per 4 acres are required.

column183: Construction, alteration, or demolition within the Historic Preservation Overlay District requires review from the Historical Committee.

The intent of the Highway Corridor Development District (HCDD) is to protect the public health, safety, and welfare by encouraging growth and economic development along the primary highway corridor within the county's development district. HCDD Overlay adjusts setbacks for lots abutting Route 17. These lots shall have a front setback of 50 feet and side and rear yards of 10 feet when adjacent to a public right-of-way.

Single-family attached (townhomes) dwellings are permitted by-right, but single-family detached require a conditional use permit (public hearing).

The maximum density may be increased to 12 units/acre with a conditional use permit.
